projectObjects.name: Pathfinding Visualizer
projectObjects.description: This is just a fun little project I did while I was bored of reading for my exams. For my part, the main focus of this project was to refresh knowledge of common pathfinding algorithms, while getting some experience with basic visualization in React. All logic is written in Javascript.

projectObjects.name: Streamlit Application
projectObjects.description: The goal is to have a simple RAG chatbot (with a streamlit interface) that can answer questions about your own data. The OpenAI API is used to do the heavy lifting, i.e., the transformer-related tasks: embed data and generate a response based on a prompt.

projectObjects.name: Clustering Visualizer
projectObjects.description: This is oretty much the same as the pathfinding visualizer, except with clustering algorithms. Visualizing the algorithms while they were running turned out to be harder than expected, and thus I've currently set everything to run instantly. I might update this with more algorithms and actual visualization later.

projectObjects.name: Sorting Visualizer
projectObjects.description: Again, this is pretty much the same as the pathfinding visualizer, but with sorting algorithms. I didn't find a way to generalize the visualization, and thus I ended up scrapping the project. It only supports merge sort.
